one_reviews_text: it's an awesome cyberpunk game, really shows a nicely crafted world, though small it may be. some puzzle solving. a bit of action. a few cool real-world old videos you can watch as part of the in-game world. ending was a bit confusing... a few types of collectibles to find. overall was an awesome experience.

This is an exemplary appetizer into the cyberpunk world quality available from this developer. It tastes of electricity, dystopia and worn android dreams. 
If this speculative fiction attracts you, bone up, drop out and jack in. This is only a taste and it will keep your processor jonesing for another fix. Taste your tears, lost in rain, understand the breadcrumbs and Easter eggs paying homage to a televised revolution and let your consciousness be digitized. 
Oh, and by the way, did I mention it’s a delicious game?

review_title: A good addition to the cyberpunk world
one_reviews_text:
If you are a cyberpunk fan, this is an absolute must have.  DO NOT give up on this due to the opening scene.  While at first you may be disappointed by the graphics and scale of items in the environment, you quickly are immersed into the developer's intent with the atmosphere and story line.  This is a small team and they did an amazing job with very little.

If anything, buy this to support them growing their cyberpunk vr army and giving us more content in the future... like LOW-FI. 🙂

I put rift on and was blown away. Yes, it is kind of cryptic in places, but that really pushes you to explore. I have gone back through and played many times and realized there were still things I hadnt seen. Its not extremely intense, but at the same time its very enveloping to the user. 

I loved the track called M.U.R.C. Run. I want to do the score for your next cyberpunk adventure.

Love the theme, big cyberpunk, Neuromancer and Blade Runner fan. The tone, aesthetic and feel of this game is fantastic! But. I have played games since 1992, and I am quite fine with games not holding players hand with extensive tutorials, but here I am stuck in this depressing little room in the beginning of the game for jack knows for how long, and have tried almost everything but still can't progress.  I refuse to google what else I must do. Dont't fall for the nice trailer and save your money. Devs obviously give 0 F's about user expierence. Just read their replies to critical reviews. Sheesh.
Update: Thank you for your replay! Admitting mistakes is very admirable thing in my opinion. Wish you success in future!
review_feedback:
Hey. Just want to say that I completely agree with you that the puzzle in the first room is dumb. This is the one of the best lessons that I've learned about VR design. Under no circumstances should the user take off the headset frustrated. That original room was made back in 2014. 

Anyway. Not trying to make excuses. Rest assured that you're right, and moving forward, the mistake wont be made again. If you want to get passed that room, Im pretty easy to get a hold of. I'll walk you through it. There arent any more dumb puzzles in the game passed it.

And I just read the last line of your review. lol. People change I guess?

one_reviews_text:
Great atmosphere! The scale is to big... but its ok... The mini games to hard but thanks for tetris i can beat one record to progress ) like it so far...

Waiting another game from same team i hope they make it in VR to.

review_title: One of the first great VR games
one_reviews_text:
Listen kids, before you all had gigabit bandwidth pumping youtube videos into your eyeballs 24/7 all we had was movies and dial-up modems.  We had to imagine our virtual worlds and what would happen if the corps and big govt took over every aspect of our lives with ubiquitous computing and cameras.  GOOD THING THAT NEVER HAPPENED! (hah!)  Technolust is a love letter to the dreams of that future that may (or may not) ever happen.  This game is EARLY in the VR scene.  It's not perfect, but, take your time and do not rush through it.  Realize that every scene has it's own audio, lighting, texture and style and that is where the world 'lives' in the game.  The Story is almost secondary to the world it exists in and it's a really fun ride.

Explore and hang out in the scenes when you can.  Think about the story that the scenery tells, there's a TON of details and nothing is mere 'background noise'.  This is video game as art in the form of a pulp cyberpunk graphic novel.  If you don't play it through at least once, you're missing out on a great experience.

Great realised Cyberpunk VR experience. For the most part it's a point n click game,with a handful of rooms/small areas to explore, with little gameplay outside of the arcade games (Kerser being the highlight) All up it feels like it could have used a bit of extra polish on the little things. Sometimes teleporting around would then have me redo things I had already had to do, "to-do list" got stuck telling me things I had already done, achievements didn't unlock, during last part certain areas became very choppy (running a 2070) and to be honest I am not sure if I even finished it.

However on sale it was good and worth my time. Hope to see more like this. A definite VR must just for the gritty cyberpunk visuals, music an atmosphere. Such a Johnny Mnemonic vibe, hope next game has a dolphin in it.

Yeah it's pretty much every cyberpunk cliche rolled into a two hour game... But ITS EVERY CYBERPUNK CLICHE ROLLED INTO A 2 HOUR GAME! 

Beautiful graphics and it's even got some replay value. I missed this when it came out, but I still really enjoyed it
It's like a mash up of Bladerunner, The Matrix and Johnny Mnemonic among others. I can't fathom out the motorcycle bit though. No controls work for me and I have to close the game and restart.

This is is a game which is, in turns, fantastic and awful; two extremes, and seldom anything in between.  It is not reviewed easily.

The concepts and inspirations it draws from align with beloved things.  Blade Runner.  Neuromancer.  TRON.  Max Headroom! (The Matrix - yuck).  The telling of the future from the perspective of the eighties.  The fact we can experience this using a VR headset today - post Space 1999 / 2001 A Space Odyssey visions.   

This game, played by us in the present, sets us back in the ideas of the eighties about today.  Wild!  This is where the game absolutely excels.  One of the best moments is the "Bits and Bytes segment" (Luba Goy, Billy Van!  Wow).  Maybe more than anything, this is the soul of the game.  If you haven't sat (or stood) through that clip in the subway, you need to.  It's the essence of this game (I hope the author forgives me for making this assumption, I would guess the clip was chosen with very specific intention, and what a brilliant choice!).

The day-to-day of the game though, sorry to say, is clunky.  Some objects we can interact with.  We can pick them up, examine them, and put them back down.  Others not.  Sometimes objects obey natural physics.  Other times, they vanish;  did they go into our inventory (which we can never examine), or teleport back to where they were picked up?

Hand controls are not intuitive either.  I will attribute this to, maybe, the author working on it before touch controllers were finalised.  Still, some objects can be added to (the) inventory (which you can never peruse) by an index finger press.  It's inconsistent and confusing.

Interface problems aside, the world that's created here with its lush audio and well chosen music, visual style, and the deliberate way in which the premise reveals itself as one explores, is perfect.

It's so difficult to assign an "out of 5" stars rating to this game, because it deserves more than just an overall. 

Verdict:  recommended!
review_feedback:
Thanks for this very thoughtful and (I think) fair review.
You can find a VHS copy of the Bit's and Bytes episode inside the subway booth to watch more comfortably in your apartment btw ;)
You're 100% right the most of the clunkyness comes from Touch support being added later. Glad you got past it and appreciated my vision regardless.

review_title: Visual Novel- PS: What song is this?????
one_reviews_text:
This is not a game, it's really like a representation of a virtual world. If you took themes from the matrix, added a retro vr vibe, and some philosophic elements this is what you get. It's truly unique and as a late oculus owner who started with touch, this is regarded as a classic for me. The artwork, story, and music is TOP quality.

PS: Devs, I know you've released a "Complete soundtrack" on bandcamp.com. Yet the song from the HOLODEXX bar is not included!! I've google music searched the song and there is no match, this is the first time i've ever heard a song this good to not be online ANYWHERE! I've made a recording of my gameplay and confirmed that shazam does not know the song, ie it "doesn't exist". I've emailed you through bandcamp about this song but no reply. Who put this track together? Where can we hear more of their fantastic work?? I'll continue to try and figure out who is on this song as it is that good, for lack of better words its a BANGER!!

PSS: For those who haven't heard this song, its like Phantogram had an lsd trip with Daft Punk
review_feedback:
Thanks for the great review :) The track from HOLODEXXX is a late addition from the expansion. It's by a band called Secret Sign, they're on bandcamp also. It's off their recent album called Night Rituals. Glad you like them, they're going to be a big part of the next game's sound track.
If you contact me directly view twitter @anticleric or the same at gmail I can send you the other missing tracks from the expansion as well.

one_reviews_text: First, let me say that I am a HUGE fan of all things Cyberpunk.  This game is the worst thing I've ever spent money on.  It's unimaginitive and NOT fun!  It just irritated me.  They think making stupid little things difficult is the same as making things challenging.  Boring!!!  Go back to bussing tables, you hacks.
review_feedback:
Just a reminder that you can refund titles on the Oculus store.
Sorry you didn't enjoy it, but there's no need to be insulting to the developer (me).

one_reviews_text: I just spent three hours in this game and I think (hope!) I’m still towards the begining! This is an interactive movie-like adventure game that mixes aspects of the TV show “Mr. Robot” with a hardcore cyberpunk feel.  I love that you have time to explore in detail the amazing creativity of the developers, writers and artists. There is no one chasing you, no one to kill (so far) but you are completely immersed in the world and can relax and check it all out. There are games within games, an arcade to jump into several completely different games. There are entire retro TV shows to watch on in-game TV screens if you want to take the time. I actually sat through an entire Canadian TV show that looked like it was from the early 80’s that gave a good education on the history and educational value of computer games, making the game itself educational. The newscasts (which appear Canadian too, based on the slight accent) are brilliant and worth listening to twice as are the ads and billboards. I have to check if the developpers are Canadian, most of my favorite sci-fi TV shows are Canadian and this feels like it may be too. If you like speeding through games to get points and accomplishments, I would suggest just stop, and really explore all the nooks and crannies and creativity that went into this without the fear of being killed (except in the mini arcade games.) Click on each character you meet several times for interesting dialogue and check out all the AI’s memories for even more content. I would have spent even more time in the game but as wonderfully immersive as it is, it can get a little dark and depressing. I hope there are some daylight scenes coming up. My only complaint is that all the scenery is really so dark. I guess electricity in this world is only used for computers and billboards, not for general lighting! I’m enjoying taking a very slow time exploring all the details and look forward to continuing and can’t wait to see what the developers do next!

An amazing experience.
There are no real "riddles", so it's more of a walking sim.
But an amazing one.
Could be longer, it took me about 3h to finish, but for me the story and atmosphere definitely make up for it, ymmv.
just awesome, the universe and all the details available in the game are just incredible.

I'm a big fan of Cyberpunk and, from the very beginning, it felt like this game was made for me.  The atmosphere is great, the storyline is interesting, the minigames diverted me for quite a while, and I still go back from time to time despite having completed it.  It's a bargain.

There's more gameplay in the various minigames than the actual core game, which is mechanically less complex than one of those 90's point and click adventure games. There is next to no requirement for gaming skill of any kind. I think the developers would have been better off not bothering with all the arcade games and "hacking", and just focused on more meaningful core gameplay. As it is, the game seems to confuse player ignorance with a sense of mystery and "puzzle solving".

Another sore point: for an experience which heavily relies on dialogue, it's often times impossible to understand what anyone is trying to say.

This would be a one star review, except for the fact that I love cyberpunk and the atmosphere of this game is spot on. If you're a diehard cyberpunk fan like me, you'll probably still get enjoyment out of this, albeit a shallow experience. I'd love to see more work from this developer.

Just being submerged in and exploring the amazingly detailed environment was enough to keep me happy for hours. Controls a bit confusing initially and a slight sense of 'incompleteness' at times - but I would so advise you try this.... fantastic graphics and sounds.

review_title: Hats off for a new form of entertainment
one_reviews_text: Spent many hours probing the dystopic cyberpunk world of Technolust only to realize that one needs to take the developer at his word – this is an interactive *novel*. It’s not a short linear experience – eg, a film that you can watch once and then walk away. It’s not a quick shooting game – eg shoot all enemies and you win. Technolust is layered and complex. You may need to visit the same scene a few times because every time you revisit a scene in this novel, you discover something new. In sum, the world reveals itself in layers – it’s akin to piecing together a giant jigsaw puzzle. I would argue that this developer is presenting a new form of entertainment – be aware that it’s not something you may have experienced before, so prepare to be a little confused in the beginning. My answer: go with it, swim with the Technolust tide. You are entering a new frontier that offers quite the journey. The scenes are visually stunning. They fulfill the VR promise of complete immersion. Throughout Technolust, I found that the embedded videos and robots boost immersion. Plugging into a robot’s memory was wild – surprising – and suddenly shifts your point of view. You will slowly learn what you need to do re gameplay – the instructions are not always in-your-face. Some may view this aspect as a negative. I see it as a positive. You are dropped into this bizarre world and need to figure it out. The clues are there. Technolust is a rare and beautiful piece. Most importantly, it advances this new medium to a new level.

review_title: Love The Setting But Gameplay Is Flat
one_reviews_text:
I am a huge fan of the Gibson Cyberpunk setting and this game absolutely nailed it.  The settings in the game are excellent, very dark future from a 1980s perspective.  The environments are not very large and I found myself wanting to interact with more of it.  There are robots and people around, they basically say one liners and that's about it.  
I found myself walking around wondering what I am supposed to do next.  I checked my watch several times which can tell you what your next mission is, but it is kind of vague.  It feels unfinished, like they created an environment but nothing to do in it.  At first it felt like ther was danger and urgency but really there isn't.  Nobody is coming for you, there is no action, and you're just walking around in a Cyberpunk world trying to figure out what the next thing is.  That thing is exact by design, very linear, and sometimes very difficult to find.  I'm not even really clear on what it is I am trying to accomplish in the game, just that I don't want to get caught... not that there is anyone actually looking for me.
In short what I would have liked with this game is MORE.   A clear story, some action, maybe a little gunplay... I mean it is Cyberpunk after all.
A couple of the games in the arcade were cool, and a couple of them were kind of silly.  The environments are well done, but does the dark future have to be so... well DARK?
I don't remember what I paid for this game but I wouldn't recommend paying more than a few bucks for it.  If there were more space to walk around in I'd consider it a viable "experience" but overall the game part of it is not very interesting.
A disappointment as I really wanted to like this one.

Kudos to the developers for creating a cyberpunk-type world I would desperately like to play more around in.  Less kudos to the developers for gameplay that falls short of the lavish world created.  This game feels like the first draft of a screenplay that you would like to see developed into a full-scale movie.
What a strange, yet interesting world that was created here.  A mixture of Blade Runner, Fallout (the Wastelands), Total Recall, and probably other references I was too slow to pick up on.  If you take the time to look around, you might find some intersting pop-culture references.  In one building in DownTown, there were cannisters in one of the shops; if you look at the top top of ther cannisters, you will see Zombies in hibernation (Return of the Living Dead, anyone).  Neat marvelous visual touches.
As for the gameplay, it's not so good.  In a number of areas, the scale feels off, like all of a sudden I was smaller compared to everything else around me.  Also, the tasks that can be accomplished by using the grip and trigger buttons need tobe better explained (trying to grab the carbon and aluminum to get out of the apartment was frustrating, but once I realized which control to use, it got easier).
The story was more often confusing than clear (not that I don't enjoy trying to figure some stuff out), like when I apply the 'cure' to the first group of people/droids in the Dance Club, and then the credits started playing on an in-game TV screen.  I thought the game was gone, but after checking some walk-throughs on-line, I discovered there was more to do.
Bottom Line: This game comes across as a rough draft of an awesome screenplay; there is some neat concepts and visuals here, but the gameplay does not match the scope of the screenplay.
I'll probably play through the game again to see what I missed.

review_title: Add this title now. Like yesterday.
one_reviews_text: If you like movies like Blade Runner, or Ghost in The Shell... You need this title. It's by far my favorite game available here in the store. I'm really hoping there is 2nd game coming! I would shop in the store more if more titles like Technolust existed.

Firstoff I'll state im a huge blade runner fan,total recall, aliens(funny Bishop ref) and other sci-fi genres and love what the devs have ref here in the game. However there are way too many bugs,graphical glitches, objects not having clipping or collision detection along with terrible scaling issues that drive me crazy. The in game VR mini games(hacker mode) were the only enjoyable experiences as the controls worked like a dream! The blurry film grain look is well over done and needs to be cleaned up by giving users the option as most games do that use any amount of excessive grain (usually done to hide AA and poor textures). I got this on sale and will be requesting a refund as the game crashes due to spatial audio (per crash report) and TBH the music is not good at all. I found myself trying to turn off and throw the annoying boomboxes that blare music above main soundtrack. 3 stars as the classic ref are there and mini games are quite good but the overall story and Main gameplay is lackluster for sure--Basically a walking sim dressed in sci-fi clothes that relies heavily on said classic references, if not for the mini games this "game" would have zero action or puzzle work etc.

review_title: Still one of my all time favorites!
one_reviews_text: Technolust has always been one of my absolute favorite VR experiences. I remember seeing the original demo back in the day and just sitting in the apartment window staring out at the animated billboards and watching the flying cars go by as I thought that this was it! This was what I had dreamed that VR would be like and that was on an early version played with a DK2. The original demo was one of the things I would use for demoing to newcomers of VR and sometimes still use this game for that purpose! If you still have yet to experience the dark and gritty Dystopian Cyber Punk future that Technolust portrays then you owe it to yourself to pick up a copy of this game!

review_title: this is art masquerading as a game
one_reviews_text:
i feel like technolust was a digital/spiritual/alienated/transcendent experience.
a must. 
no other VR app has this kind of atmosphere

review_title: Made in 2016 but still very worth it.
one_reviews_text:
Technolust is on some aspect a little dated, but if you are looking for a strong dive into a blade runner like universe, it's a must have.

The mood, the music and general ambience are very solid, they will drive you to do the whole game in one very long sitting and ask for more a sign of great engaging content!

It runs great on my outaded pc, so that's a big plus.

I bought it nearly 2 years ago and now that I heard about Technolust 2 in developement, if I could buy it twice or more to support the dev, I would.
It was that good.

Dunno how people can even think about giving this game a rating below 3 stars. 
The first time I played technolust has been before it even was in the oculus store and I hadn´t have touch controllers. I remember the first time when I sat at the desk and I saw the city outside the window, I instantly stood up and wanted to walk up to the window..unfortunately I forgot that something was next to me and I almost stumbled over the floor. The game itself has a huge immersion and I had nostalgic feelings when encountering all the arcade stations and of course it felt kind a like blade runner´ish. If this guy would have more financial ressources unimaginable what he could accomplish in the vr genre. Just buy it.

Really like this game, it's rough around the edges in 2018 but THATS OK. This game is a labor of love that was upgraded from an Oculus Dev Kit experience to a full blown game. 

I promise you haven't played anything like it before, and will be itching for Technolust 2 by the time you're done.

review_title: A fine title, still a little buggy
one_reviews_text: Nice music, and re-playability, lasts many hours. In a playtime of 10h: I was stuck in Amity's room (trigger for her 'leaving' is broken, happened 2 times). Also problems with MC-speedrun that left/right joystick motion did sometimes not work, and not exiting ever in level 2 (no enemies left). Load/relocate that never finished (blackness), and some Oculus-achievements not unlocking correctly (as I see it). Still no show stopper, and I like it otherwise and there was quick response from the devs so it's a 5, hoping to see these things fixed...

This game when it came out showed a lot of potential. Unfortunately on many many regards it's lacking. Interactions with objects are poorly done, Objects scale is off in most cases. Its felt all through that the itle lacked the resources and the team to complete a fulfilling experience. It deserves its respect for the time it came out, early dk2 days. People purchasing it now will get disappointed.

review_title: Classic Rift Experience - Except for Bug
one_reviews_text:
This is one of the early "experiences" on the Rift and still impresses to this day.  You're dropped into a cyberpunk world that's Neuromancer with a little bit of Max Headroom the TV series.

The author added a lot more content since it's first release which added much needed story content.

The character models are a wee bit too "Disney Animatronic-y" but the environments are incredible.  I like to walk through it once a year or so.

Unfortunately I've never gotten to see the "Alternative Ending" due to a bug where going into the wreckshop after going up to the tower in Mars always crashes the game.  I've tried this on three different computers with the same result.  So I can never return after killing the AI...very disappointing.

Also, be aware that if you're reinstalling this after already have installed it, and you get a little pop-up saying that you need to install Direct X 9c, try rebooting.  Thats what fixed it for me.
review_feedback: Glad you figured out the Dx9 issue. Thanks for the review :)

one_reviews_text: I was really getting into this game when I hit the ending and could not help but think that someone was under a deadline and just stopped making it. It seriuosly feels like only half of the game is here because you go to the ending section (trying to avoid spoilers) and then suddenly poof...its over. Wasted potential here.
review_feedback: There are multiple endings. Did you do the HalfJack missions that you pick up at the Wreckshop in the Downtown section? Sounds like you missed a bunch.

one_reviews_text: In a VR game ever. Minigames are great, and the quiet point&click gameplay works perfect. There's some scale errors and i wish it was a little longer but overall it's a great experience.
This game has been in my head for years.  The creator is a true artist.  Very much looking forward to the sequel.

review_title: a lot to see and do
one_reviews_text: Actually, I have no idea what I'm doing, but it's fun to do it. Since there is a lot to see and to do, it does not get boring. Navigation is very intuitive, all tasks are easy to solve so far. The graphics are beautiful and perfect. And having the techno music all around is alsa very nice. Good to know: Navigation can easily be changed from teleport to slide, so it's suitable for everyone. Definitely worth the money, and a good VR experience.
I really like the game... the athmosphere is so intense... And there is VR TETRIS!!!!

review_title: Good but very hard to play while sitting
one_reviews_text:
it says that it can be played while sitting.
but i found that it is very hard (and sometimes impossible) to pick up
things (items). kindly add crouch button or function that pick up things while
being distant from them. Thanks
review_feedback:
There is no need to pick anything up off the floor in the game.
The game was designed and tested entirely seated. No plot dependent items can be dropped. If you let go of them, the return to their origin point. Anything that can be interacted with can be done so without picking it up as the game was initially designed without Touch controllers. You can simply look at an object and click the Right Trigger or A button to add it to your "inventory".

review_title: This is exactly what I was looking for!!
one_reviews_text: Techno Lust makes me happy. It's the exactly the future I have long dreamed about.
really great game, different than others. Nice theme and music.

Update:  Apologies, the developer is right.  My lack of hardware should not have influenced my review.  I am still dying to play this game, just have to be patient and wait I suppose.  I'll give it 5 like everyone else until they update revive with a fix.

I want to like this game.  If I could play it.
review_feedback: Thank you for this! Sorry for the late reply. I don't think I was informed by the store that you updated your review.

one_reviews_text:
If you are craving a dystopian cyberpunk adventure remeniscent of Blade Runner then look no further.  This is an older game but still a classic for VR and I haven't seen anything as of yet that can compare atmosphere wise.  
Graphics:  Graphically the game does a great job of putting you there.  I think it was origially a seated experience so the scale may appear a tad off but  not so much that it ruins the game.  I just love the lighting and grunginess of the city and other areas you explore.  The story is driven along in some points with live action actors which actually works really well with immersing you into this world.  The character models look good but there are no facial animations so they seem a bit odd.  many of them have masks or are robots so it works.  
Sound: I love it!  pounding driving techno music, spacial audio, just over all the sound is great.  I particually love the get your a$$ to mars tune.  
Game Play/story:  This is an adventure game at heart.  It does a really great job of letting you pretend and be someone else for a while in a really well crafted world.  It's not huge,. I think it took me maybe 4 hours to complete, and I was sad when it was over.  The controls worked great,. except for some of the mini games in the arcade but I was playing with Vive wands so that may have been my issue.  
Final Verdict:  This may be an older game, but it is a VR classic!  If you don't have it, you should!  Blade Runner in VR.  What's not to like?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rDhMRfV4qnw

My Thoughts:
I overlooked this game when it was first released in 2017 but I'm really glad I got to experience it now. What an incredible experience, I felt like I was in a Blade Runner universe.

The atmosphere, graphics, music and gameplay was cleverly done and so entertaining.

This is a must for any VR Sci-Fi fan.
Very good atmosphere. It's an unique experience. Kind of like some 90's scifi movie except that the protagonist is you.

review_title: for an early game...a great VR example
one_reviews_text: Quite frankly, when you first boot up in your apartment near your desk and the window at the beginning of the game...its an example of how wonderful VR is. you literally are transported to another enviroment that for all intent and purpose...makes you feel you are "there".  this is the power of VR. I love the notion that stepping into a whole other world...is as easy as putting on a headset.

If you are in the mood for cyberpunk you can't go wrong. Graphics are pretty good and there is quite a bit to interact with. The length is decent for a VR game in my opinion and the game was pretty cheap.

I see a few reviews where they are unable to control aspects of the game, I experienced none of this. 
I see reviews where the player cant get out of the first room, It took me a while but I eventually worked it out after 20 minutes or so, so keep trying - You have paid for the experience so do it.
I love all the mini games in the arcade, there are some great gems so make sure you try all the machines. I guess I am only halfway through this game but so far so good. 

Maybe an update is due to fix scaling, I didn't notice it too much but others did...

No issues on my GTX 1070 + i5 4760K 16GB RAM setup. 

Props to the devs on this cyberpunk game.

So I have now spent 20 minutes in a boring room telling me to use my personal computer.  Great where the F is that, I keep moving around, nothing to do, s**t.  Do I just waste my life on this crap.

Where is my f**king computer?  There are computers in the room that do nothing!!!

Don't go near this rubbish

i play it with my xbox controller and i see the two hands with the touch controllers on my face, its very annoying, and when i tried to hack with the coin op game, the dummy coundt move.... only kicks
review_feedback: Hmm.. sounds like an issue with gamepad support. Will look into it. Touch Version should work fine if you have access to them.

one_reviews_text:
I just bought the game and I managed to play it with my controller to the point where you have to hack a arcade game console. I start the hacking minigame but the controls simply don't work! I can't move the character. She only kicks and shoots but DOES NOT MOVE. I just wasted my money for nothing. I would love the be able to play the game because it has great mood and atmosphere. If the devs read this, please help!
I'm using CV1 not DK2. I SAID I HAVE CV1 NOT DK2, GOD DAMIT!

It had atmosphere for the first part, and had some promise then the last half was- not great imo- it seemed rushed and pushes you towards the end quickly with not much if anything to it. The NPCs were very wooden. The graphics are okay (not great, not bad), although there is a world scale issue that makes everyone look bigger than they should. The part riding the bike to "unlock memories" performed poorly on my Gtx 1080, also spent a lot of time trying to finish the second memory but the "target" never showed up. I gave up on that bit. A bug maybe, I had to repeat the first part of the game many times before googling why the game wasn't saving. Something with a Y in front of the save file.

review_title: What I want VR to be
one_reviews_text: I'm an old player who cut his teeth on the Atari 2600.  For me, when I remember the 80's I remember Romero Undead, Buckaroo Bonzai, Blade Runner, Mad Max, etc.  Punk was the best thing about that decade and this game gets it.  I enjoyed every moment and what little bugs there are doesn't take away from the pure fun of this game.  The atmosphere is spot-on, music on-point and culture references to rival Joss Whedon.  Must have at this price point for anybody who wants more than a shooter or racer.  My system CV-1, touch, 980TI-FTW, and i7 second gen at 3.9 ghz.

review_title: Did I dream of Electric Sheep?
one_reviews_text:
Highly recommended cyberpunk adventure that makes you feel like 'Deckard on acid'... If this is the shape of whats to come then bring it on right now! Absolutely superb experience!! Just make sure if it doesnt boot you have the correct c++ 2015 runtime files installed from Microsoft website... 
"Too bad she wont live... but then again who does?"

the intro is great , all tron like , would have loved hanging around but i get sent to a room which has nothing to do with tron.  its obviously a large person's room as i dwarf around the furniture  trying to figure out what next to do.. so i google.. oh there is a door that i must exit. so i google more to figure out how to ..  this goes on for quite a while which includes a 3d printer which doesnt look like a 3d printer .. i  then realise that all i need to do is collect items and the damm machine will work .. anyways. i get out. and google more.. i am out.. i google somemore .. its probably me.. this may be gold for gamers but i dont get it.

Great game with paying respects to a lot of cyberpunk inspiration.
As mentioned in other reviews, the scale does seem a bit off to me. Everything in the world feels oversized

good: cyberpunk feel with a lot of fun references, good music
Bad: scaling is way off, doesn't feel polished
This was the first game I felt totally immersed in VR and transported to another place.  That was bak in devkit times.  Cant wait to play it on the CV1.  Art direction on this game is incredible.

review_title: It's what the 90's inspired to be.
one_reviews_text: If you love Blade Runner and Hackers This game is for you. The music is incredible the mini games are fun and the world is extremly immersive. You cant go wrong for 10$

review_title: Had a save issue, now fixed.
one_reviews_text: If your game is not saving, make sure the save.txt for technolust does not start with a 'ý' character.  Else you may have to loop the intro.  I have about 20 hours of play, easily.  If you liked 90s FMV games, that and the environment should do you well.

The feel, graphical style and sounds/music in this game are just fantastic. Its reminds me of Blade Runner. Unfortunately it does need some of the extra stuff (such as the green beginning) to be removed because it weakens the quality significantly and offers very little. This game did not make me sick with the movement the way some games do. Perhaps because most of the environments are darker. Some of the puzzles are boring and I found myself having to look at Youtube for solutions as I lost my patience. It feels like a game that is unpolished. However the atmosphere, Blade Runner style and sound make it one of my favourite places/games to be in VR.

I can't say much more than the controls while in the games in the VR world just don't seem to work and they glitch I think I had to front kick to move my guy in the one hacking thing just to progress the story.  Pretty quickly you get to an arcade and you have no idea what button does what.  I am hoping the touch will make this more playable, but with a controller forget it.  If stuff this early on is this bad then I bet it will get way worse.
review_feedback:
The problems you describe are only present when playing with the DK2.
DK2 is no longer supported.

one_reviews_text:
Says it supports 360 controller yet the sticks do nothing in minigames making it impossible to progress. Developer is saying this has something to do with using a DK2 but it is clearly an issue with the 360 control pad - plus CV1 users are reporting the same issue. 

Complete cop-out developer response and waste of money. AVOID!

Update:

See dev's predictable response below that should read as "I simply can't be arsed".   Perhaps someone should inform the dev that the DK2 still works perfectly with OH 1.17 and also works perfectly with Technolust. It's the gamepad support that is broken since the update - and then only a very specific part of it. 

Even if the gamepad support was fixed, I doubt I would return to this vacant, meat-and-potatoes demo - which ironically belongs in 2014 with the DK2. 

There is far too much better stuff on here to care.
review_feedback: Are you on DK2? Sounds like you are.

one_reviews_text: I love this game.  Worth the money. I just wish it was longer.  If you love retro this is your jam!

Beautiful graphics, and a real sense of being in another world.  The scale is a bit big, and the interaction a little clunky, but I guess that's just the game's age.  So much content here.  It's like visiting a diferent world, a sci-fi lover's dream.
Really enjoying this 100% from me!

No where near the fidelity of job simulator or rick/morty, but the environment is fantastic.  Reviews recommended a gamepad, but I can't see doing this without using touch controllers (and I was unable to use my gamepad and was stuck in initial credits hell until I decided to try grabbing my touch controllers).  It's a bit frustrating that we have to access control options (step/smooth yaw) via a PC in the apartment - I get the focus toward immersion, but I'd rather set those before I get immersed.  Also, why no subtitles? (Hell, for all I know there was a separate interface in the apartment to turn them on.)

One of the best VR games. But after update for touch support I have virtual device in my front of view and I cant turn it off. I dont have oculus touch, I play it with gamepad. Any ideas how to fix this issue? Is there any setting for turn touch off?

10 minutes of goofing around and i've made it crash a number of times already. really surprised considering this has been out quite a while. turorial (or lack there of) isn't good either. even on sale, definitely pass

review_title: More a Demo then a Game
one_reviews_text: 1-2 years ago that was probably a good VR Experience but there is not much behind it. Some city builds where you wander around. It is not worth a price of 25 USD anymore in my opinion. There is much better stuff out there for that money. I think it is my worst buy - at least for the price I paid.
Exactly what anyone who loves sci-fi and cyberpunk thinks of when they think of the dystopian world of tomorrow. Truly amazing atmosphere.

Excellent replayable experience and worth twice the fee.It is excellent the things you do to this game I think it is like being in our favorite movies)
I love to praise Jesus!
Most mind-blowing adventure experience in VR. Get lost in the cyberpunk dystopia you've only seen in other media. Crazy little details all over. In awe!

After hours of testing, I managed to get the game to work with my Virtuix Omni via gamepad emulation. Unfortunately, the game disables the gamepad input if your Touch controllers are visible to your cameras... which means you can't use Touch (hands) and Omni (feet) at the same time. It's absurd: you literally need to hide the Touch controller under your arms/shirt so that you can use the Omni to walk around. Why would the developers intentionally disable one of your inputs if the other is also in use? Let ME decide what combination of controllers I want to use. Technolust could be the first perfect, fully active VR experience... and all the developer needs to do is NOT deliberately block gamepad input when Touch is also in use. Absolutely frustrating. >:-(
review_feedback: I'm sorry to hear your frustration, but I think your review is unfair, considering Omni support was never advertised. I'm not doing anything to block gamepad functionality when touch is being used. The game uses Oculus' OVRinput method. This means that Xbox or Touch should function properly. Not sure about Omni.

one_reviews_text: After supporting the crowdfunding campaign of Technolust years ago, I played the demos on the DK2 then the final game on the consumer version Rift with Xbox controller - and I loved it. Now I played through it a second time using Touch. The additional content is not much, but very cool. One of the best VR adventure games just got better. Still too short, but worth every cent.
The neonoir technodystopia VR experience you've been dreaming of since the first time you saw Blade Runner. The only problem is when it's all over you'll want more.

review_title: PLAY THIS IF YOU ARE A FAN OF THE MATRIX
one_reviews_text: THIS IS WITHOUT A DOUBT MY FAVORITE GAME ON OCULUS. I love the numerous references made to nostalgic movies like blade runner and the matrix in this game! Do not listen to the haters, this absolutely the best game on oculus and I have tried just about everything on oculus. This game is so amazing that it makes desperately yearn for something like this or possibly an expansion for this game. Do not miss out on this VR DEFINING experience because of some idiot who played the game for 2 seconds and then made an instant profound judgment!

I waited to play this till Touch support was added and it does not disappoint. The graphics are amazing, the environments feel believable. It is Matrix, Blade Runner and Hackers all rolled into one. Thanks to the developers for adding Touch. I am enjoying your game a lot!

review_title: do not buy worst game i ever played
one_reviews_text: i don't write many reviews howevver this might just be the worst game ever. not really a game even more of a 168 coke fueled rampage by the watchoski bros (or sisters) on plot structure,charcter development and common sence. anyone who liked it DID NOT PLAY IT. it is a walking simulator that is all you walk. (no crafting no talking to ppl no anything) you just walk as a story unfolds around you. the dumbest matrix rip off of a story ever. there is like 50 lines of dialoge in the whole thing and somehow in 50lines they managed at lease 19 different plot holes seriously 19 plot holes is my count.infact the game even teases you with the prospect of being able to do more then walk to slap you down and laugh at your face. i can not even beilive someone thought this crappy story that does not make sence in ANYWAY shape or form and i incurage the dev to get a hold of me so they can try to explain my rpoblems away

This title should be a free app. The visuals are nice, but this is a weak addition to the VR library. The level of effort by the game designers is poor. It feels like they had a much larger vision and got in over their heads. The result is a half-baked storyline and a clunky interface. VR offers a rich pallet which only a few developers have mastered. I'm looking forward to seeing the day more talent matches the tech.

Technolust is hands down my favorite game in VR hands down. I've played through it multiple times since I purchased my rift and I can honestly say everything about this game aside from the length is perfect. I've done everything there is to do in the game yet I find myself wanting to run through it again just to be inside the experience. A must buy if you enjoy cyperpunk or just want a good exploration game. Just keep in mind that if you don't enjoy the world enough to play through it again, its only about an hour long.

**UPDATE: i added a star, downloading patch now. will add another if touch works well.**
____________________________________________________________________________________________________

Again - why no touch controlers option, why no update? i realize oculus pushed many devs to pump out a titles to fill the gap, but no update. EVERY SINGLE oculus title should have had an update ready to release the very same day the touch controlers where released, EVERY TITILE.  If the pad works better for some users, (namely the playstation/360 kids crowd) fine, let them use a stupid controller, but im a PC gamer and have never own a console.  I use keyboard/mouse. The transition to touch was extreem, but intuitve. Unlike controlers which are totally oldschool tech from 30 years ago (nintendo). I feel frustration every time i find a game that looks cool, but in the fine print it says "controler" instead of "touch".  I WILL NOT BUY A SINGLE GAME FROM THIS POINT ON THAT DOES NOT USE THE TOUCH CONTROLERS. NO NO NO NO NO!

review_title: A whole new game with Touch
one_reviews_text: Before the addition of Touch I experienced some motion sickness but now with this update it is a whole new game. And fun! Sometimes I have trouble following what the characters are saying. Apart from that this game is a a must have for Cyberpunk fans.

review_title: Not just a game--its a retro-futuristic
one_reviews_text: People who talk about how quickly this game can be "beaten" are missing the point...this is not so much a game to be played as a world to be explored! Pick up objects, open doors and molest androids with the Touch controllers. The environments are gritty and awesome, with tons of Easter eggs to find, the storyline is good and the atmosphere is amazing. In addition, there are at least a half-dozen playable mini-games in the Arcade, all of which have a lot of replay value in themselves--with each game, you don't just stand at a console but actually "jack in" and enter a playable virtual reality environment. A slight bug (which may not be present on all systems) keeps me from going to the previously played scene by pressing the "B" button -- I have to choose the desired level from the map. This caused me to deduct 1 star. If I were going to create a game in VR and I had the skill to do so it would probably be something like Technolust.

Love the arcade mini games and the collectibles give a purpose to wander around in this amazing world.

I did get stuck a couple times but eventually figured it out.  It would be cool if all the games in the arcade could be playable.

review_title: Loved this game , cant wait to replay
one_reviews_text: Can not wait to replay this game with touch, even with a controller it was my first real sense of presence. Between charcters eyes following you and also I didnt realize i was walking into a garbage can in the game while i was kneeling down and I fell over as I bumped into it which was pretty incredible. Great story, FULL GAME
Very buggy and difficult to understand. I loved the cyberpunk atmosphere and hope to see another game aim for a similar theme, but with better execution.

I decided to put this game down about an hour in upon hearing that it was going to obtain motion control support once Oculus Touch came out.

As it stands, it is a nice typical 'point-and-click' style adventure game with incredible visuals that screams for room-scale/motion controllers for interaction.  Fascinating arcade games are a fun distraction and add to the value of this "less gamey" game as a whole.  Got nauseous with the gamepad controls, hoping the patches and updates will cause this to be a non-issue and my 4-Star rating reflects that.
I have no idea what the story was about becuase of terrible audio, but the atmosphere was awesome.
Not a bad game. Great one the first play through although after playing through once not much reason to go back. Worth the price IMO.
I really liked this game, it has the best story and the games lasts for a long time

Absolutely incredible game. The attention to detail in every corner of this title is astounding. The soundtrack is also fantastic and goes really well with the theme of the game. I could spend hours in the arcade alone (contains a bunch of mini games)

review_title: One of the first "real" games I played!
one_reviews_text:
I highly recommend this game. The world is just stunning and it features normal locomotion so you can freely explore it! 

It feels a little bit like a small Fallout game in VR but with it's own charm!

The first couple areas are exactly what you want, but there just isn't much to the last half (or more) of the game.  The plot never really takes off and ends abruptly.  It seems like the developer ran out of steam early in the project.  It's all the more disappointing for the promise the first areas show.

You know those stories you used to have to write in school that initially were really exciting, and you had this awesome plot and fleshed out characters and all these cool ideas, but as the deadline drew near you began to lose interest/time and cut everything down and ended it with some half-as*ed ending? That's what this feels like.
It's pretty cool at first, has a good feeling, sets a great mood. But halfway through everything just goes downhill. The story, environments, interactions. By the end the only reason I was still playing was because I said to myself, "Welp.. I've come this far."
The ending is terrible.
I really enjoyed it!
I wish there were more games like this! Looking forward to re-play it once the touch support is released.
